text: Harry Glenville "Doc" Tonkin (August 11, 1881 – May 30, 1959) was a Major League Baseball pitcher. Tonkin played in one game for the Washington Senators in . He pitched in 2.2 innings, and gave up six hits and two earned runs. Tonkin was born in Concord, New Hampshire and died in Miami, Florida. ==External links== *Baseball Reference.com page Category:1881 births Category:1959 deaths Category:Washington Senators (1901–1960) players Category:Baseball players from New Hampshire
title: Doc Tonkin
